skillTree.localised_description: The best of all horse breeds found anywhere in the world, Elven steeds are noble, intelligent, graceful, and swift.

effects.description:
Passive Ability: "Keep the Distance and Keep Shooting" for Ranged Cavalry units
	(all units in army)

unit_ability.onscreen_name: Keep the Distance and Keep Shooting!

skillTree.localised_description: Its forehead adorned with a spiral horn, this noble mount carries the Wood Seer where their magical gifts are needed most.

effects.description:
Passive Ability: "Kill the Tresspassers" for Melee Cavalry units
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: Ulthuan's Great Eagles are the firm allies of the Elves, fighting their causes since the coming of Chaos.

effects.description:
Passive Ability: "Death from Above" for Eagle and Hawk units
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: Radiants are unusual glowing Spites that usually manifest as a little more than a blurred shape of pure light. They act as magic sponges, sapping the power of enemy mages

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve: +5 per turn

Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve change: -5% when increasing
	(local region)
Winds of Magic power reserve: +10 per turn

Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve change: -10% when increasing
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Elven hunters emulate Kurnous, the God of the Hunt. Their speed and swiftness is therefore without peer.
A ranger should give no reprieve to the foe. Arrows must fall like a deluge, as deadly as lightning.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Lord charges their troops to fight for Athel Loren, for their very souls are tethered to its fate.
This ritualistic war dance requires neither rhythm nor order, enabling evasion of the enemy’s clumsy attacks, and lethal counterattacks.
Once consumed by Loec’s aspect, one can instinctively evade attack through trickery, mimicking his deception of the Dark Gods.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Possessed by the Trickster God"

skillTree.localised_description: The Lord sets their eye upon the foe, imbuing their troops with Kurnous' spirit and the will to see his enemies destroyed.
This Lord can spot an enemy at a distance that defies belief, and demands their troops do the same.
When the arrow flies farther, it may kill sooner, which is vital in the Hunt.
Nook and fire. Nook again, and fire. Nook a third time, and fire. All in a heartbeat.
The forest teaches a warrior not only when to fire but where, which makes a bigger difference.
Always willing to fight on, a widened quiver allows arrows to rain, almost without end.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Taking their cue from the forest itself, the Lord endures and overcomes all.
Using the forest itself as a shield, this Lord is protected by their devotion to Athel Loren.
By all means summon the bloodthirsty Goddess of the Hunt to assist you, but always make sure you thank her afterwards…
When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target
Requires line of sight to the target

skillTree.localised_description: The Archmage crackles and flows with energies that would unmake any mortal practitioner.

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

skillTree.localised_description: Moving like the wind, whistling past tree branches, the riders of the forest hunt any who would do harm to the place they call home.

skillTree.localised_description: All of Athel Loren shouts with a fury as old as the ages, and the enemy knows its power.

skillTree.localised_description: The denizens of the forest will travel many miles to see those who would threaten Athel Loren put to rout.
Athel Loren provides for its deserving children, with wondrous boons gifted in recognition of their many endeavours.
The Worldroots provide succour for their children, purging the forests of any corrupting infestation.
The magics of the woods obscure and connive, able to turn enemy blades away from their targets.
The forest provides for its warriors, rehabilitating and regenerating wounds suffered in its defence.
From all corners of the forest, they come to defend their homes.
The dead do not want for material possessions, yet the living may yet find value in them…

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: Like the forest itself, the warriors of Athel Loren ebb and flow and regenerate with the passing of time.
The forest-dwellers draw from the strength of Kurnous to fight ever harder, and be ever stronger.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The Wood Seer belongs ot the Kindred of Yenayla. Sometimes known as Tree-singers or Grove-kin, they are very close to the forest, often acting as emissaries and ambassadors between the Wood Elves and the older spirits of the Athel Loren itself
